title: Increase in foreign language
body:
Back in 2014 i would rarely see anyone who speaks any non English languages but more recently ive been seeing them pop up more. 

Playing with these players who speak english perfectly but refuse to do so makes communication very hard, escpecially when the chat blows up with 2 or 3 players talking to eachother in chinese or taiwanese.

Just to clarify im talking about full blown speakers. Not someone who paste in a few korean phrases. 

I was just wondering are these players in the wrong? Can anything be done about this?

replies.body: Sure it can be annoying that they can't communicate with you and it can be really frustrating sometimes, but honestly, it doesn't matter.

Nah for us who had come back from the NA, we have a fair bit amount of experiences in dealing with multi-languages in 1 game considering in every game on NA back then it would have at least 1 full Spanish and/or Portuguese speaker, being on our side or theirs.

While Taiwanese have their local native languages, they all type using Mandarin (their official language) online like the Chinese (who has a shiet ton of different local native languages within their region), because pinyin only supports it as you can't really use any other input language in-game besides English.

Anyway, it's not wrong to use an entirely different language, it's only bad when they do something bad with it.

The only problem here is the players playing from across the sea for no good reason, they should stick with their region unless they really don't have one, otherwise as long as there is no bad behaviour then it's not wrong.
they're in the void. VOID KOREANS COMING SOON 1350RP, CHAMPION + SKIN + CHROMA PACKS 6969RP 30% DISCOUNTURUUUUU

*cough*#StillBetterThanDoTA2Russians*cough*

But no, not in normals, I'm not too sure about ranked.


EDIT: Well. I just had a bad experience. I'll tell you now that it's alright only if they at least try to communicate at an acceptable level to the team. "ADC/Mid/Top/Support/Jungle is weakness", "I ADC/Mid/Top because I select first" "Bad you doing the game, feed the stopping" "Premade invite no anymore do" "You not good feeding a enemy hard it makes for us" is not acceptable, even if they do manage to say it correctly. The only time I'd accept it is if they said something like "My enemy top disappear from line"

What annoys me is the fact I've had a non native speaker be like "I no talk an English goodly, but I first select (insta lock) so role is gotten"

A language barrier isn't a reportable offence. While the community generally agrees that English is the language to use there is no official language for the OCE server. That said, there is a difference between language barrier and refusal to communicate.

If they can't speak English but use pings to communicate, they're not in the wrong. This is a language barrier.

If they can speak English but use pings to communicate, they're not in the wrong. I know this might seem a little silly but it's not refusing to communicate, and many people do it.

If they refuse to communicate by any means, regardless of whether or not they speak English, they're in the wrong.
